column4: why "yawn"? - i tried a dozen distros before Ubuntu none worked - How about a "Pat on the back"?
I just meant there are so many satisfied custoners it's getting to the stage where you yawn every time :)
- getting set up and everything in ubuntu to your liking takes a little time - could there be an application to easily back everything up?
there are quite a few - e.g.rsync, tar, dd
if you mean back up all your configs, it isn't necessary if you use dist-upgrade to upgrade your system
you can also use the gnome file-roller to tar files for backup if you wish
you can use dd to save the mbr ( it's just the first 512 bytes on the hard drive), but be careful!
lame will do that
or Audacity
it isn't compulsory :)
I only have 512MB but I use the 686 kernel anyway
I haven't a clue ;-)
several
no, I'm pretty ordinary actually
linux=kernel  GNU/Linux + the whole OS
- Sorry i ask so many questions and have so few answers. (5th week with linux)
why are you apologising? You have more clues than most beginners
lspci -vvv | less migh tbe easier to read
